Name: Stela of Redenef-ni
Description: The stela is framed on three sides by a flattened torus moulding and closed at the top by a cavetto cornice, which is worked in relief. The texts and scenes have been incised into the stone, the inner details of the scenes have been partly worked in relief. Under two rows of text, two men are depicted facing each other over a well-stocked offering table. To the left stands a woman.
